description: This notification is generated when the pw's status
changed.
Used in the outgoing PW ID field within the 'Virtual
Circuit FEC Element'.
variables.name: HUAWEI-PW-CMD-MIB::hwPwCmdPwID

description: Indicates the status of the PW:
down(1)
up(2)
plugout(3).
variables.name: HUAWEI-PW-CMD-MIB::hwPwCmdPwVcStatus

description: This notification is generated when the pw's deleted.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-PW-CMD-MIB::hwPwCmdPwDeleted PW-STD-MIB::pwIndex u 1 PW-STD-MIB::pwType i 0 PW-STD-MIB::pwID u 9999 PW-STD-MIB::pwPeerAddrType i 0 PW-STD-MIB::pwPeerAddr s EXAMPLE

description: A unique index for the conceptual row identifying a PW within
this table.
variables.name: PW-STD-MIB::pwIndex

description: This value indicates the emulated service to be carried over
this PW.
variables.name: PW-STD-MIB::pwType

description: Pseudowire identifier.
If the pwOwner object is 'pwIdFecSignaling' or
'l2tpControlProtocol', then this object is signaled in the
outgoing PW ID field within the 'Virtual Circuit FEC
Element'. For other values of pwOwner, this object is not
signaled and it MAY be set to zero.
For implementations that support the pwIndexMappingTable
a non-zero value is RECOMMENDED, even if this
identifier is not signaled. This is so that reverse
mappings can be provided by pwIndexMappingTable and
pwPeerMappingTable. It is therefore RECOMMENDED that the
value of this pwID be unique (or if pwPeerAddrType is not
'unknown', at least [pwType, pwID, pwPeerAddrType, pwPeerAddr]
is unique.)
variables.name: PW-STD-MIB::pwID

description: Denotes the address type of the peer node. It should be
set to 'unknown' if PE/PW maintenance protocol is not used
and the address is unknown.
variables.name: PW-STD-MIB::pwPeerAddrType

description: This object contains the value of the peer node address
of the PW/PE maintenance protocol entity. This object
SHOULD contain a value of all zeroes if not applicable
(pwPeerAddrType is 'unknown').
variables.name: PW-STD-MIB::pwPeerAddr

description: This notification is generated when the pw recovered
the service.
The first object is the index of the first pw,
and the other is the index of the last pw.
A unique index for the conceptual row identifying a PW within
this table.
variables.name: PW-STD-MIB::pwIndex

description: A unique index for the conceptual row identifying a PW within
this table.
variables.name: PW-STD-MIB::pwIndex

description: This notification is generated when the pw service
has some faults.
The first object is the index of the first pw,
and the other is the index of the last pw.
A unique index for the conceptual row identifying a PW within
this table.
variables.name: PW-STD-MIB::pwIndex

description: A unique index for the conceptual row identifying a PW within
this table.
variables.name: PW-STD-MIB::pwIndex

description: This notification is generated when the service
switches over to the secondary PW.
The first object is the index of primary pw,
and the other is the index of secondary pw.

event.Summary: Service switched over to secondary PW $v2

description: A unique index for the conceptual row identifying a PW within
this table.
variables.name: PW-STD-MIB::pwIndex

description: A unique index for the conceptual row identifying a PW within
this table.
variables.name: PW-STD-MIB::pwIndex

description: This notification is generated when the service
switches over to the primary PW.
The first object is the index of primary pw,
and the other is the index of secondary pw.

event.Summary: Service switched over to primary PW $v1

description: A unique index for the conceptual row identifying a PW within
this table.
variables.name: PW-STD-MIB::pwIndex

description: A unique index for the conceptual row identifying a PW within
this table.
variables.name: PW-STD-MIB::pwIndex

description: This notification is generated when the MPLS
service switches from the protect tunnel to the
work tunnel.
The first object is the index of work-tunnel,
and the other is the index of protect-tunnel.

event.Summary: MPLS service switched from protect to work tunnel

description: Indicates the index of tunnel.
Range: 1-64
variables.name: HUAWEI-PW-CMD-MIB::hwPwCmdTunnId

description: Indicates the index of tunnel.
Range: 1-64
variables.name: HUAWEI-PW-CMD-MIB::hwPwCmdTunnId

description: This notification is generated when the MPLS
service switches from the work-tunnel to the
protect-tunnel.
The first object is the index of protect-tunnel,
and the other is the index of work-tunnel.

event.Summary: MPLS service switched from work to protect tunnel

description: Indicates the index of tunnel.
Range: 1-64
variables.name: HUAWEI-PW-CMD-MIB::hwPwCmdTunnId

description: Indicates the index of tunnel.
Range: 1-64
variables.name: HUAWEI-PW-CMD-MIB::hwPwCmdTunnId
